column4: When I do "sudo apt-get update" I get: GPG error: http://kubuntu.org dapper Release: The following signatures couldn't be verified because the public key is not available: NO_PUBKEY A506E6D4DD4D5088. What could be the problem?
you need to download the Public key and then add it to apt
let me find you an url
thanks
go to http://ubuntuforums.org/forumdisplay.php?f=41
there you search for compiz error
there I posted an aswer to your question
searched for that pubkey but didn't find any newly created topic or so
go to http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=216993
np
didn't work,   libpango1.0-dev: Depends: libglib2.0-dev (>= 2.10.0) but it is not going to be  installed
in which step did that error come, what did you type?

oh sorry, that was from another problem :D I got: oskar@grapefactory:~$ gpg --armor --export 1F41B907 > keyName.gpg // gpg: WARNING: nothing exported // oskar@grapefactory:~$ sudo apt-key add keyName.gpg // gpg: no valid OpenPGP data found. though
did you do the first command with the ---recv-keys param?

yepp, got gpg: requesting key ED8A569E from hkp server wwwkeys.eu.pgp.net  gpg: key ED8A569E: "Quinn Storm <livinglatexkali@gmail.com>" not changed  gpg: Total number processed: 1  gpg:              unchanged: 1
you've got to use the same key in the second command as in the first
so it works?
nope, doesn't work
so what's up?
gpg: Total number processed: 1  gpg:              unchanged: 1 I guess
or gpg --keyserver hkp://wwwkeys.eu.pgp.net --recv-keys
